title: Confusing errors with missing `let` in `if let`

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: D-confusing

labels.name: D-newcomer-roadblock

body:
I thought this code would provide one of the nice suggestions that @estebank implemented in #75931, but it doesn't. (By the way, making `cache` a reference to `Cache` will give an ICE because of #77218.)

```rust
pub struct Cache {
    data: Vec<i32>,
}

pub fn list_data(cache: Cache, key: &usize) {
    for reference in vec![1, 2, 3] {
        if /*let*/ Some(reference) = cache.data.get(*key) {
            unimplemented!()
        }
    }
}

```

([Playground](https://play.rust-lang.org/?version=nightly&mode=debug&edition=2018&gist=b966071ee150b38ed62adf1e2315b3ff))

Errors:

```
   Compiling playground v0.0.1 (/playground)
error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/lib.rs:7:38
  |
7 |         if /*let*/ Some(reference) = cache.data.get(*key) {
  |                                      ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected integer, found `&i32`
  |
  = note: expected enum `Option<{integer}>`
             found enum `Option<&i32>`

error[E0308]: mismatched types
 --> src/lib.rs:7:20
  |
7 |         if /*let*/ Some(reference) = cache.data.get(*key) {
  |                    ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ expected `bool`, found `()`

error: aborting due to 2 previous errors

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0308`.
error: could not compile `playground`

To learn more, run the command again with --verbose.

```
